sn47.28:4.3: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things have you developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
sn47.28:4.4: “Reverend, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.28:5.2: It’s when I meditate by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.28:5.3: I meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.28:5.5: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.28:5.6: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.28:5.7: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly know the entire galaxy.”
